summary: This is a Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York Daily Activity Report for July 19, 2019. It details routine operational issues like staff shortages, equipment malfunctions, and inmate population counts. The document is significant as it provides a snapshot of the facility's operations shortly before Jeffrey Epstein's death there in August 2019.

events.title: MCC New York Daily Operations
events.description: Routine daily operations at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, including reports of a malfunctioning control center door, staff shortages in the Special Housing Unit (SHU), and inmate population counts.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: This is a routine daily activity report from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York dated July 20, 2019, covering the previous day's operations.
The report notes a control center door malfunction that required manual operation and staff shortages affecting posts in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) and other areas.
The total inmate population at the beginning of the morning watch on July 19, 2019, was 787, with detailed counts per housing unit.
The document provides context on the facility's operational status and staffing approximately three weeks before Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody at MCC New York in August 2019.
No specific inmates, including Jeffrey Epstein, are named in this particular report excerpt.
